title: INS launches Web site to track students with visas
body:
The Immigration and Naturalization Service has launched the Internet Web site that the nation's universities will 
soon use to register foreign students.

The move is the first step in the government's plan to track the movements of all those with temporary visas, 
according to INS officials.

Schools that have received INS permission to accept foreign students for three years can begin using the Web 
site system immediately, the agency announced Tuesday.

Other schools will have to go through an extended review period to gain approval to use the system, called 
"SEVIS." The system will become mandatory Jan. 30, 2003.
